result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya Helen Toney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonya Helen Toney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dispo/assessments entered.
Justice Point-Pretrial Report

Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for pretrial conference, however, parties have reached a resolution.
Pursuant to Negotiations and on the Motion of the State.    
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Court ordered charge amended to Disroderly conduct pursuant to 63.01 County Ordinance. to which Defendant plead no contest. Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.  
Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $100.00 including costs to be paid by 01-17-2017. Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of fines is conversion into a civil judgment and income tax interception.
Court orders defendant to write a letter of apology within 30 days (11-17-2016) to the victim, sent by District Attorney Office.


Justice Point report, received and filed.

Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned to Branch 31.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 31.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called and case passed to allow defense counsel time to appear.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hannah Dugan, Branch 31.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point-Pretrial Report
Defendant Tonya Helen Toney not in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Bench warrant issued on April 28, 2015 to remain in effect.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Tonya Helen Toney not in court.  No appearance for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Case called to address JusticePoint violation.  Defendant failing to comply with JusticePoint, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  Court ordered Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Tonya Helen Toney in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
